snippet: The bid for Smithfield Foods, America’s biggest pork producer, points to a type of cooperation between Wall Street and Asia’s elites that may be on the rise.
abstract: Bid for Smithfield Foods, America’s biggest pork producer, by Chinese company Shuanghui International points to type of cooperation between Wall Street and Asia’s elites that may be on the rise; offers blueprint for future cross-border mergers and acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: The bid for Smithfield Foods, America’s biggest pork producer, points to a type of cooperation between Wall Street and Asia’s elites that may be on the rise.

headline.seo: Behind the Chinese Bid for Smithfield Foods
headline.main: Chinese Bid for U.S. Pork Had Links to Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Chinese Bid For U.S. Pork Had Links To Wall St.
